result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Francis Kroyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Francis Kroyer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Francis Kroyer was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the debt is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Francis Kroyer

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

01:21 PM Defendant Christopher Francis Kroyer in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Larimore: guily to Ct#3 with $500 fine. ADA Schieffer: dismiss Ct#1-2. Explains reasons for plea to Ct#3.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#3. Counsel stipulate to factual basis.   Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty of Ct#3. Dismiss Ct#1-2. ADA Schieffer and Atty Larimore address sentencing. Court: orders $500 fine, 3 months to pay, DNA sample within 30 days.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Adjustment Number: 22A 014657,
Payable Number: 68141,
Receipt Number: 22R 002063,
Amount: $20.00
Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court adjourned at 1:07 pm.
filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif

1:03 PM Defendant Christopher Francis Kroyer appears in Court, Atty Joel Kenneth Larimore, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Larimore wishes to waive the PH. Court questions DE.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  The Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for further proceedings.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to possess controlled substances without a valid prescription.

3:09 PM Defendant Christopher Francis Kroyer appeared in court in custody, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. ADA Walker is requesting a $2,500.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS & Not to possess controlled subs., no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:17 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
